items.headline: Amazon reportedly plans to cut 30,000 jobs. The nation’s second-biggest private employer is remaking its workforce.
items.summary_en: Move would follow reports of cuts at Target, Meta and elsewhere.

items.headline: ‘I think we’ve been lied to’: Who exactly is considered rich in America?
items.summary_en: A middle-class person in America would be considered rich beyond most people’s wildest dreams in many parts of the world.

items.headline: Qualcomm ups its game in AI, sending its stock to a 15-month high

items.headline: CarMax to leave the S&P 500 to give way to this famous industrial company’s spinoff
items.summary_en: A place in the S&P 500 is a sought-after spot for companies, as it exposes their stock to a broad swath of active investors and to countless passive funds that track the benchmark automatically.

items.headline: Why the odds of gas prices falling below $2 anytime soon are one in a million
items.summary_en: Gasoline prices at the pump last week fell to their lowest average intraday price in four years, but aren’t likely to see a dip below $2 a gallon any time soon.
